display_asset.caption: Of this season’s seven 1,000-yard rushers, only Adrian Peterson, above, of the Vikings, plays for a playoff team.

summaries.body: A trend toward more passing and other factors have led to fewer running backs reaching 1,000 yards. Seven did it this season, the lowest number since 1991.
Tweets about Israel landed a New Jersey student in the principal’s office. She says she was warned that comments about fellow students may have broken an anti-bullying law.

display_asset.caption: Gennaro Marano preparing a pizza on Monday at Il Cavallino, a restaurant in San Vitaliano, Italy. In an effort to decrease air pollution, the mayor of the town, Antonio Falcone, issued an ordinance banning the use of wood-fired stoves not equipped with proper filters.
display_asset.credit: Gianni Cipriano for The New York Times

summaries.body: In the birthplace of pizza, the mayor of San Vitaliano, Italy, has angered local pizzeria owners by requiring emission filters on wood-fired stoves.

display_asset.caption: Donald J. Trump arriving at the opening of the Trump International Golf Links course in Aberdeen, Scotland, in 2012.

summaries.body: Donald Trump has threatened to abandon plans to invest more than $1 billion in Scotland if Britain bars him from the country over his comments on Muslims.

display_asset.caption: Senator Kirsten Gillibrand with Ethan and Allison Acton at a news conference in 2014. Ms. Gillibrand, a Democrat from New York, has backed a national family leave act.

summaries.body: While recent efforts on paid leave for new parents are welcome, advocates say, they address just a sliver of the challenges that working families face.
Microsoft will stop supporting Internet Explorer 8, 9 and 10 next week, making them vulnerable to hackers. Users can still upgrade to version 11.
James F. Tracy, a Florida Atlantic University professor who suggested that the 2012 massacre of children at Sandy Hook Elementary was a hoax, was fired Tuesday.

The character Rey will be included in new versions of the Monopoly: “Star Wars” game, Hasbro said. There were complaints when she wasn’t included in an earlier edition, which the company said was done to avoid spoilers.

display_asset.credit: Bryan Anselm for The New York Times

summaries.body: Los Angeles County prosecutors cited the statute of limitations and insufficient evidence in saying no charges would be filed in two cases against Bill Cosby.

display_asset.caption: Romeo Miller, left, and his father, Master P, on the WE tv show “Growing Up Hip Hop.”

summaries.body: ‘Growing Up Hip Hop,’ a show that has its premiere Thursday on WE tv, contends that being raised by a famed musician has perils along with the obvious perks.

display_asset.caption: Shops selling ingredients for traditional Chinese medicine, including manta ray gills, in Guangzhou, China. A rapid decline in the world’s manta populations means that gills may soon be going off the market.
display_asset.credit: Adam Dean for The New York Times

summaries.body: Overfishing of manta rays, whose gills are sold for elixirs despite research that they might be harmful, is leading China to consider a ban on sales of manta ray gills.

display_asset.caption: The sixth season of “Girls,” scheduled to be broadcast in 2017, will be its last, HBO said.

summaries.body: The HBO show "Girls," with its frank and less than glamorous depiction of early adulthood, will say goodbye when its sixth and final season is broadcast in 2017.

display_asset.caption: Larycia Hawkins, an associate professor of political science at Wheaton College, wore a hijab at a church service in Chicago.
display_asset.credit: Stacey Wescott/Chicago Tribune, via Associated Press

summaries.body: Wheaton College began a process Tuesday that could lead to the termination of a Christian professor who said she stood "in religious solidarity" with Muslims.

display_asset.caption: People trying out Oculus Rift virtual reality headsets at a promotional event in London last March.
display_asset.credit: Tim P. Whitby/Getty Images for Westfield

summaries.body: Facebook has finally put a price on its Oculus Rift virtual reality goggles, listing the headset and controller devices at $599, and said it would begin shipping orders in March.
Amid reports that Twitter was considering a 10,000-character limit, many people lobbied for what they consider a more essential function: the ability to edit tweets.
Chipotle has been issued a federal subpoena as part of a criminal investigation tied to a norovirus outbreak that originated at its restaurant in Simi Valley, Calif., in August.
Jaden Smith, the 17-year-old rapper-actor-designer son of Will Smith and Jada Pinkett Smith, wears a skirt in a new Louis Vuitton campaign addressing gender fluidity.

display_asset.caption: Shoppers in Hollywood, Fla., looking at a Jeep Wrangler sport utility vehicle. Sales of Jeep vehicles soared nearly 40 percent last month as more consumers chose to buy S.U.V.s and trucks.

summaries.body: Strong consumer demand for pickups and S.U.V.s has helped the auto industry set an annual record of 17.5 million vehicles sold in the U.S. in 2015.

display_asset.credit: Ben Solomon for The New York Times

summaries.body: Allen Campbell, the personal chef for Tom Brady and Gisele Bundchen, says he provides them with a diet that consists of 80 percent vegetables.

display_asset.caption: Adele’s “25,” the most popular album of the year with more than seven million sales, was not on streaming services.

summaries.body: The prevailing theme in the music business has been that CD and download sales are plunging while streaming is rising. In 2015, Adele was the exception.
A woman who went out with Martin Shkreli on a Tinder date last fall described the pharmaceutical executive as nervous, and shorter than she expected.
Chris Gayle, a Jamaican cricket star, sparked outrage online by asking Mel McLaughlin, a female reporter, to join him for a drink as he was being interviewed on live TV.

display_asset.caption: Paul DePodesta, right, who was the Mets' vice president for player development, with Mets Manager Terry Collins.

summaries.body: The Cleveland Browns have hired Paul DePodesta, a strategist for the Mets who is a highly regarded baseball mind and who was featured in the movie "Moneyball."

display_asset.caption: Jack Dorsey, Twitter’s chief executive, has made clear to employees that as far as redesigning the product is concerned, no feature is sacred.

summaries.body: Under the direction of its chief executive, Jack Dorsey, Twitter is experimenting with introducing a longer form of the tweet, a change from the 140-character limit.

display_asset.caption: Cpl. Eric Johnson was arrested on Tuesday in Yuma, Ariz., on a murder warrant in a shooting in Denton, Tex.
display_asset.credit: Yuma County Sheriff’s Office, via Associated Press

summaries.body: A Marine corporal was arrested in the death of a University of North Texas student who was shot while driving friends from a New Year’s Eve party.

display_asset.caption: Tonya Couch, left, appeared in a Los Angeles courtroom and waived extradition to Texas.

summaries.body: Tonya Couch, the mother of the teenager who claimed “affluenza” in a fatal drunken-driving case, waived extradition in California and agreed to return to Texas.

display_asset.caption: Dairy calves peered around snow piles at Dutch Road Dairy in Muleshoe, Tex., on Monday. The dairy lost 300 of its 2,200 cows during a blizzard that began on Dec. 26.
display_asset.credit: Allison Terry for The New York Times

summaries.body: A two-day blizzard in West Texas and New Mexico killed 35,000 dairy cows just after Christmas. The region produces 10 percent of the milk in the United States.
Thanks to El Niño, a parade of storms is bringing much-needed rain to California, a state sapped by four years of drought. Emergency agencies are on high alert.
A prosecutor featured in "Making a Murderer" said the Netflix documentary omitted crucial facts in the trial of Steven Avery, above, who has drawn a wave of support.

display_asset.caption: Tom Kearney, the York County district attorney, said that along with 247 pounds of marijuana and $11,000 in cash, the authorities found Christopher M. Heath’s badge and duty firearm.

summaries.body: After a Northern California anti-drug task force member was arrested with 200 pounds of marijuana in Pennsylvania, the authorities are reviewing his cases.
